title: How to Locate the Service Tag of Your Dell PC, Tablet, or Accessory

steps.title: On a laptop
steps.content: On a laptop You'll usually find your service tag on the bottom panel of your Dell notebook computer. [1] X Research source Some laptops, including XPS and Precision models, have a flap over the sticker. If you don't see a sticker on the bottom of your laptop, lift the flap to expose it.

steps.title: On a desktop or all-in-one PC
steps.content: On a desktop or all-in-one PC On a Dell desktop computer, you'll usually find the black or white sticker containing the service tag on the top, side, or back panel of the tower. On an all-in-one PC, the sticker is typically on the back of the monitor near the bottom. [2] X Research source

steps.title: On a printer
steps.content: On a printer The location of your service tag depends on the type of printer: On a laser printer, you'll find the service tag inside the toner compartment or bay. On an inkjet all-in-one printer, lift the scanner lid to find the service tag sticker. [3] X Research source Depending on the printer, you may also see the service tag sticker on the back panel.

steps.title: On a monitor
steps.content: On a monitor If you have a Dell monitor sold in 2016 or later, you'll find your service tag on the back panel of the monitor. If your monitor is older, it does not have a service tag—instead, you can identify your monitor model by signing in to www.dell.com/support . [4] X Research source

steps.title: On a tablet
steps.content: On a tablet On most tablets, you'll find your service tag on a narrow black sticker on the bottom edge of your tablet. On other tablets, you'll see the sticker on the back side of the tablet toward the bottom-right edge. [5] X Research source

steps.title: On a projector or docking station
steps.content: On a projector or docking station The service tag sticker is on the bottom of the projector or docking station. You will need to lift the device up to see it. [6] X Research source If you don't see a sticker, check the storage bag that came with the device. Just look for the words "Service Tag" or "Serial Number" to find the 7-digit Service Tag code.

steps.title: Open SupportAssist on your Dell computer or tablet.
steps.content: Open SupportAssist on your Dell computer or tablet. The SupportAssist app comes preinstalled on Dell desktop and laptop computers, as well as Windows-based tablets. Once you open SupportAsssist, click Start , and you'll find your service tag at the top-right corner of the app. [7] X Research source To open SupportAssist, click or tap the Search icon in the taskbar, type support , and then click or tap SupportAssist . If you don't have SupportAssist, you can download it from [8] X Research source . If you have an Android tablet, jump down to Using Android Settings.

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+S or the Windows key on your keyboard.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + S or the Windows key on your keyboard. This activates the Windows Search bar next to the Start menu.

steps.title: Type cmd into the Search bar.
steps.content: Type cmd into the Search bar. A list of results will appear.

steps.title: Click Command Prompt in the search results.
steps.content: Click Command Prompt in the search results. This opens the Windows Command Prompt . [9] X Research source

steps.title: Type wmic bios get serialnumber at the prompt.
steps.content: Type wmic bios get serialnumber at the prompt. Once you do, press ↵ Enter . The Service Tag is the 7-digit alphanumeric code below "SerialNumber." [10] X Research source

steps.title: Press Ctrl+Alt+T.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + Alt + T . This opens a terminal window on your Linux system. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Type sudo dmidecode -s system-serial-number.
steps.content: Type sudo dmidecode -s system-serial-number . Once you do, press ↵ Enter . You will be prompted for your account password. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Enter your password and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Enter your password and press ↵ Enter . Once your password is accepted, you'll find the 7-digit alphanumeric Service Tag below "SerialNumber."

steps.title: Turn off your Dell desktop or laptop PC.
steps.content: Turn off your Dell desktop or laptop PC. If you can't boot your computer into Windows or Linux and don't see the service tag sticker, you can get your Dell service tag in the BIOS or UEFI. Begin by powering the computer off.

steps.title: Turn the PC back on and press F2 on the Dell logo screen.
steps.content: Turn the PC back on and press F2 on the Dell logo screen. You'll need to be quick with this move—make sure you press this key as soon as you see the Dell logo. Press it several times quickly, and don't stop until you see the BIOS or UEFI screen. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Select the System Information or Overview section.
steps.content: Select the System Information or Overview section. The BIOS (or UEFI) will be different on each system, but you'll find the service tag is in a section with one of these two names. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Open your Android's Settings .
steps.content: Open your Android's Settings . Use this method if your Dell tablet came with Android instead of Windows. To find your Settings, open your list of apps, then tap Settings .

steps.title: Tap About Tablet.
steps.content: Tap About Tablet . You may have to scroll down a little to find it.

steps.title: Find the Service Tag next to "Service Tag" or "Serial Number."
steps.content: Find the Service Tag next to "Service Tag" or "Serial Number." It's the 7-digit code containing both letters and numbers.

If you want to look up information about a Dell product, such as warranty status, specs, service requests, and driver updates, use Dell's Service Tag Lookup tool . Just enter your service tag into the "Identify your product or search support" field, then click Search .

steps.title: What can you do with a Dell service tag?
steps.content: What can you do with a Dell service tag? You can use your service tag to look up product specs, documentation, and warranty information for your Dell device. If you call or chat with Dell support, you may also be asked to provide your service tag so the representative can properly identify your computer.

steps.title: How do I check my warranty status with a Dell service tag?
steps.content: How do I check my warranty status with a Dell service tag? Go to the Dell Support homepage, enter your service tag under "Identify your product or search support," then click Search. Once your product is found, click View Warranty Details to learn more about your warranty. [15] X Research source www.dell.com/support/contents/en-in/videos/videoplayer/how-to-check-warranty-details-online/1691420408517951285

steps.title: Why is my Dell service tag not found?
steps.content: Why is my Dell service tag not found? If you are unable to find a service tag, there could be a few different reasons: [16] X Research source Your Dell device is too new, and the service tag isn't yet in the database. Fix: Wait 2 days and try again. If it still isn't found, call Dell tech support. Your Dell device is too old to have a service tag. Fix: Find your Dell model by browsing the product list . You are mistyping the service tag or entering the wrong number. Fix: Make sure you are only entering the alphanumeric service tag code. Don't enter any extra letters, like "ST", "S/N", or "Service Tag."

steps.title: How do you use a Dell service tag to check specs?
steps.content: How do you use a Dell service tag to check specs? Go to the Dell Support website , enter your service tag into the "Identify your product or search support" field, and click Search . From there, click the Overview tab in the left panel, then click View product specs under "Quick Links".
